0.name: Presence1
0.text:
Many years ago in a time long passed.
A young man stood between the flowers in a ray of moonlight.
Observing the stars, taking in the beauty that is the universe.
He did this every night. And every time it was breathtaking.
But on one fateful night it was different.
He saw a bright light in the sky.
A comet?, A creature? no, something more.
He described it as a soul or a presence..
 And it spoke.
There between the flowers he listened to this voice from deep space.
It sounded powerful, but vague. A message he couldn't understand.
Yet he was inspired. He had to hear this again.
He had to tell everyone he knew.
This was something special.

1.name: Presence2
1.text:
And every night he went back to that spot.
Hoping to see that light again.
But he didn't. For days he waited, hoping.
And it wasn't until the seventh day when he heard it again. He saw it in the sky.
He was certain it was real.
The message was equally vague. Now he was determined.

He explained it to his friends. It took a lot of convincing to get them to join him for one night.

And that night it was there. They all saw it. Moving across the sky.
Yet only he was able to hear it.
But they believed him.
They weren't sure what to make of it.
They all sat there, pondering, wondering.
What or... who is this?

2.name: Presence3
2.text:
They brought this newfound knowledge to the village. They told everyone.
While of course there were a lot of sceptics, there were few who had seen this light before when they were young. It had never spoken to them however.
Maybe it wasn't a creature. Or something akin to that. Maybe it was the essence of their moon. Like a spirit, a presence as they described it.
It only made sense...
And so they wished to see it again. To hopefully hear it speak, again.
They built shrines to please this presence.
And even those of others.
They started giving them names, bodies, appearences, identities.
They would bring gifts to please them.
They would care for nature. The well being of their moon. Hoping to hear it again.

... They never did, but they kept trying.

3.name: Task5
3.text:
I have made it to faith but my health has rapidly declined.
I can barely walk.

It's there, I feel it sitting in my chest...
Growing...
This tumor.
I escaped the war..     I SURVIVED
And this is how the universe rewards me?
Life is suffering.
Always has been, from the moment I was created.
One month after being born I was already on the battlefield. Posessing memories of someone I'm not.
They didn't even give me a name.
I was a number. A duplicate of someone else.
...
My body is crumbling, I should get going.
And when I'm done.
All my problems will go away.


My salvation lies on Berunah.
